projects.title: Honours Programme - Dewaterability of Sewage Sludge
projects.description:
Under the Honours Programme at TU Delft, I am pursuing research in the field of dewaterability of sewage sludge particularly focusing on TORWASH Technology which involves high temperature treatment of sewage sludge.  

- Potential to reduce the amount of sludge produced by 85% which could save 85 Million Euros annually in transportation cost of sludge in Netherlands alone. 

- Formalizing a research plan, formulating and conducting experiments and analyzing the obtained results.

- The project is still undergoing and has already yielded some interesting results.

profile_positions.description:
The Topic is "Recovery of magnesium from concentrated brine and reuse it for struvite production". My thesis is to perform a feasibility study on how this can be achieved. 

The tasks include interacting with different employees from various departments in order to take into account the technical considerations, researching about technologies and process schemes which can work, using various models to simulate the process and talking with experts.  After this, a technology would be chosen taking into consideration the carbon footprint, cost, sustainability of the process, material usage, etc.

Finally the study will end with a complete LCA.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis

profile_positions.description:
- Topic: “Pilot study on potential transition effects subjected to disinfectant changes”. The transition effects will be investigated between unchlorinated, chlorinated with free chlorine and chlorinated with monochloramine systems.

- Responsibilities include maintaining and operating the pilot plant, solving problems while making sure the continuance of the pilot operation, dosage calculations, sample collection, experiments on the collected sample and data analysis.

- The main objective is to study the changes in multiple phases (bulk water, suspended solids, biofilm) between unchlorinated and chlorinated DWDSs in perspective of physicochemical (e.g., pH, ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, TOC, elements) and microbiological (i.e., ATP, intact cell number) aspects and to see the transition effects after switching disinfectants.
profile_positions.title: Pilot Study Intern

profile_positions.description:
The Symposium committee is responsible for organizing the annual symposium on an upcoming and important topic for the tracks of Environmental Engineering and Water Management of Civil Engineering Department at TU Delft.  I with my teammates organized the Symposium for year 2021 on the topic "What a Disaster" which focused on resilience of existing system in regards to a shock. The tasks involve but are not limited to:

-researching about the new concerns and challenging regarding sustainability in the water sector and conceptualizing a topic which could cover those concerns

-contacting the companies which are doing innovative work in the said topic about taking part in the symposium

-finding the pioneers in the said topic and contacting them for being a speaker at the symposium

-organizing the whole event (practicalities, schedule, food etc.)

I learned some valuable skills during my time in this committee such as multi-tasking, efficient management of schedule, writing professional emails and forming invaluable connections in the water sector. This year due to covid, a full scale symposium was not possible but we planned in advance for such circumstances and were able to organize a successful hybrid symposium giving the audience and the speakers/companies the best of both platforms, and at the same time adhering to covid rules and guidelines.
profile_positions.title: Committee Member (Symposium Committee)

profile_positions.description:
I had to study the existing water treatment plant supplying water to the cooling towers and De-mineralizing plant of a thermal power plant; and figure out to way to use treated wastewater instead of surface water as the inlet water for the treatment plant. 

The task involved interacting with personnel at different levels within the company to understand the working of the treatment plant better.  It also involved a holistic review of available market ready technologies which could supplement the existing treatment scheme. It enabled me to develop a solution finding mindset for sustainable ways of innovating existing systems according to environmental guidelines or company's future ambitions.
profile_positions.title: Circular Water Use Intern

profile_positions.description:
During my work at R4 Enviro, I worked directly under the guidance of a Senior Environmental Engineer who had an experience of 28 years in the field of Environmental Compliance.  

My experience here was quite comprehensive as I learned to solve several interrelated project elements in a holistic manner, such as planning and design of rainwater harvesting systems and groundwater recharge pits, rejuvenation of local surface water bodies, filing of NOC certificates for groundwater extraction and usage for companies, making water-budget of companies and identifying key areas where water usage could be minimized or if particular process water could be reused after certain treatment.
